intro: Nectandra savannarum, commonly known as the yellow sand-wood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, reddish-brown heartwood and yellow sap. The tree typically grows in lowland rainforests and moist savannas, reaching heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. Nectandra savannarum is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local medicine and crafts.
